definition: use a long line to catch a big fish (idiom); a long-term plan for major returns

definition: to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)
length/long/forever/always/constantly
chief/head/elder/to grow/to develop/to increase/to enhance
thread/string/wire/line/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3],根[gen1]/(after a number) tier (unofficial ranking of a Chinese city)

to fish with a hook and bait
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

sentences.english: Put long term angle big fish, this is a kind of method that is used by most forum.
sentences.chinese: 放长线钓大鱼，这是被大多数论坛采用的一种方法。

sentences.english: First, investors have to develop a longer time horizon.
sentences.chinese: 首先，投资者需要拥有放长线钓大鱼的能力。

sentences.english: As over Bushehr, Iran plays a long game.
sentences.chinese: 至于布什尔，伊朗可以说是放长线钓大鱼。

sentences.english: Misaki Sato wanted to go fishing, he practices on the horse Xiaoqie some doubts.
sentences.chinese: 佐藤想放长线钓大鱼，他对马小茄的做法有些疑惑。

definition: In order to capture, one must let loose./to loosen the reins only to grasp them better
lit. to pull a snake from its hole/to expose a malefactor (idiom)
to take the bait
you don't release the hawk until you've seen the hare (idiom)/one doesn't act before one is sure to succeed
pinyin: bu4 jian4 tu4 zi5 bu4 sa1 ying1

definition: to beat sb at their own game (idiom)
one who is not prepared to risk his child will never catch the wolf (proverb)/(fig.) one who is unwilling to take risks will not achieve great things

definition: rigorous schemes and deep foresight (idiom); astute and circumspect
bait
lit. to toss a stone to find out what's ahead (idiom)/fig. to test the waters
to quit while one is ahead (idiom)/to know when to stop
lit. please Sir, get into the boiling pot (idiom)/fig. to give sb a taste of his own medicine
lit. a crafty rabbit has three burrows/a sly individual has more than one plan to fall back on (idiom)
to lure the tiger from its domain in the mountains (idiom)/to lure an enemy away from his territory
to threaten the east and strike to the west (idiom)/to create a diversion
lit. to guard a tree-stump, waiting for rabbits (idiom)/to wait idly for opportunities/to trust to chance rather than show initiative
delaying tactics/stalling/measures to stave off an attack/stratagem to win a respite
